info.title: CSE-341 Team 9 Final Project REST API
info.description: A temple work REST API developed by Ashlee Butterfield, Madison Lutz, Jonas Nunn, Mike Lewis

get.summary: Return API name and version number.
get.description: This endpoint simply returns an object containing the name of the API, version number, and author.

200.description: Returns the version information for the API.

name.example: CSE-341 Team 9 Final Project REST API

author.example: Ashlee Butterfield, Madison Lutz, Jonas Nunn, Mike Lewis

get.description: Executes the main Swagger documentation user interface handler.

200.description: A functioning web page is returned allowing the user to navigate the documentation. No JSON data is returned on this route.

get.summary: Return the entire list of completed records.
get.description: Returns all completed records in the collection. No filtering is applied.

200.description: All completed records are successfully fetched and returned in an array.

post.description: Adds a single completed record using information provided in a JSON body.

parameters.name: record
parameters.description: A valid JSON object with required data elements populated.

201.description: Created - A single completed record is added with the data given. The return result provides the newly assigned ID number.

get.description: Returns the completed record identified by `id` for a single family member record that has had all temple work completed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A valid and unique 24-digit hexadecimal string that identifies a family member record that has had all temple work completed.

200.description: A single completed record identified by `id` is successfully returned.

put.description: Updates the completed record identified by `id` using information provided in a JSON body.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A valid and unique 24-digit hexadecimal string that identifies a completed record.

parameters.name: record
parameters.description: A valid JSON object populated with one or more data fields to be changed.

204.description: Success - The completed record identified by `id` is updated with the new data. No data is returned other than this status.

delete.description: Deletes a completed record identified by `id`. If `id` does not exist, no action is taken and no error occurs. Check the `deletedCount` attribute in the response to determine if a completed record was actually deleted.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A valid and unique 24-digit hexadecimal string that identifies a completed record.

200.description: The completed record identified by `id` is deleted from the collection if it exists. The response is an object containing an aknowledgement and the number of matching completed record(s) deleted.
